tr.td:
Value of extension
Binding: NummerSoortCodelijst (extensible): NummerSoortCodelijst

description.value: Base StructureDefinition for Address Type with additions for Dutch realm addresses. Dutch addresses break down Address.line in several parts and it is important to mark an address as being 'officially registered'.

purpose.value: Address information is used for visiting a person or organization and for addressing of mail.

name.value: ContactInformation as part of HCIM Patient-v2.0.1(2015EN)

comment.value: ContactInformation has become an independent information model as of release 2017 of the HCIMs

name.value: ContactInformation as part of HCIM Patient-v3.0(2016EN)

comment.value: ContactInformation has become an independent information model as of release 2017 of the HCIMs

definition.value: Contact information includes a person's telephone numbers en e-mail addresses.

label.value: Mobile business phone number. Note: the mobile nature stems from the number being an 06-* number.
Mobile phone number undetermined private/business. Note: the mobile nature stems from the number being an 06-* number.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
A system is required if a value is provided.

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

definition.value: Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.

comment.value: TelecomType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/TelecomSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointSystem
EmailAddressType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/EmailSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointSystem
EmailAddressType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/EmailSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointSystem
EmailAddressType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/EmailSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointSystem

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references)
An Extension

Defines a more specific coded value for a code or string. Especially useful for FHIR's required ValueSets. These extensions are primarily used on codes bound to a required value set, where you would like to use a more specific code than the codes in the bounded value set.

alias.value: Bevat de specifieke code conform de zib, bij een FHIR-element die een verplichte koppeling heeft met een bepaalde FHIR waardelijst of een FHIR element die niet gecodeerd is gedefinieerd, terwijl de zib dit wel doet.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

comment.value: EmailAddressType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/EmailSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointSystem

definition.value: Defines a more specific coded value for a code or string. Especially useful for FHIR's required ValueSets. These extensions are primarily used on codes bound to a required value set, where you would like to use a more specific code than the codes in the bounded value set.

alias.value: Bevat de specifieke code conform de zib, bij een FHIR-element die een verplichte koppeling heeft met een bepaalde FHIR waardelijst of een FHIR element die niet gecodeerd is gedefinieerd, terwijl de zib dit wel doet.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

comment.value: TelecomType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/TelecomSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointSystem

definition.value: Primitive value for code
The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).

comment.value: Additional text data such as phone extension numbers, or notes about use of the contact are sometimes included in the value.

requirements.value: Need to support legacy numbers that are not in a tightly controlled format.

definition.value: Purpose of this contact point

comment.value: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not mistake a temporary or old contact etc.for a current/permanent one. Applications can assume that a contact is current unless it explicitly says that it is temporary or old.

requirements.value: Need to track the way a person uses this contact, so a user can choose which is appropriate for their purpose.

map.value: XTN.2 - but often indicated by field

comment.value: TelecomType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/TelecomSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointUse
NumberType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/NummerSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointUse
NumberType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/NummerSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointUse

EmailAddressType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/EmailSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointUse

comment.value: TelecomType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/TelecomSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointUse

definition.value: Defines a more specific coded value for a code or string. Especially useful for FHIR's required ValueSets. These extensions are primarily used on codes bound to a required value set, where you would like to use a more specific code than the codes in the bounded value set.

alias.value: Bevat de specifieke code conform de zib, bij een FHIR-element die een verplichte koppeling heeft met een bepaalde FHIR waardelijst of een FHIR element die niet gecodeerd is gedefinieerd, terwijl de zib dit wel doet.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comment.value: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

short.value: identifies the meaning of the extension

definition.value: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.

comment.value: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

definition.value: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

comment.value: NumberType. See for details the ConceptMap https://simplifier.net/resolve?target=simplifier&canonical=http://nictiz.nl/fhir/ConceptMap/NummerSoortCodelijst-to-ContactPointUse

definition.value: Primitive value for code

short.value: Specify preferred order of use (1 = highest)

definition.value: Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. Contacts are ranked with lower values coming before higher values.

comment.value: Note that rank does not necessarily follow the order in which the contacts are represented in the instance.

short.value: Time period when the contact point was/is in use

definition.value: Time period when the contact point was/is in use.
Contact information includes a person's telephone numbers en e-mail addresses.

label.value: Mobile business phone number. Note: the mobile nature stems from the number being an 06-* number.
Mobile phone number undetermined private/business. Note: the mobile nature stems from the number being an 06-* number.
